greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where T(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..n} 2^j * binomial(n,j) * binomial(k*n+j+1,n)/(k*n+j+1).
formula: G.f. A_k(x) of column k satisfies A_k(x) = 1 + x * A_k(x)^k * (1 + 2 * A_k(x)).
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Sum[2^j * Binomial[n, j] * Binomial[k*n + j + 1, n]/(k*n + j + 1), {j, 0, n}]; Table[T[k, n - k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 27 2020 *)
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = local(A=1+x*O(x^n)); for(i=0, n, A=1+x*A^k*(1+2*A)); polcoeff(A, n)}
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Jul 26 2020
